content.question: Aside from their function as places for sacred worship, the Great Stupa at Sanchi and Chartres Cathedral are similar in that both were built

choices.label: to compete in size with nearby religious structures
as mausoleums for kings and their families
to attract pilgrims through their links with relics
as monuments memorializing the sites of battles

content.answer: to attract pilgrims through their links with relics

unit.text: 8: South, East, and Southeast Asia, 300 BCE - 1980 CE

topic.text: 8.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in South, East, and Southeast Asian Art

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe similarities and/or differences in two or more works of art using appropriate and relevant points of comparison.
